intro: Cicuta mackenzieana, commonly known as the Mackenzie water hemlock, is a toxic plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in compound umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to North America and often grows in wetlands and along stream banks. Due to its high toxicity, it should be avoided and handled with care.
